basics.name: Richard Baltazar
basics.label: Information & Computer Sciences Graduate
basics.summary: Recent Information and Computer Sciences graduate eager to begin a career in software development. Experienced in web and client-based application development through university projects, with a strong foundation in problem-solving and technical concepts. Procient in troubleshooting and system maintenance, with CompTIA A+ certification. Committed to continuous learning, writing clean and efficient code, and contributing to innovative solutions in a collaborative environment.

courses: Developed skills in explaining technical concepts to users, assisting in software and system navigation, and providing step-by-step troubleshooting guidance
Familiarity with computer parts and problems associated with malfunctioning of each component
Understanding of cybersecurity principles, user access control, and proper procedures for system maintenance and data protection

work.summary: Student office assistant for the academic advising office
highlights: Assist college counselors/advisors in office with technical and physical tasks that range from creating powerpoints for new student orientation, to redacting private student information on archived files
Collaborated with front desk personnel to answer phone calls and use problem solving skills to redirect students to appropriate resource for the situation they are experiencing
Develop simple excel scripts for improvement of convenience for college advisors
Collaborate with a group of volunteers to perform sanitation tasks along the HCC campus ranging from the library to the cafeteria
